contextId.occurrenceNote: Often people would sit on the ground to show they were mourning. Alternate translation: "sit on the ground, mourning in silence" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: sit on the ground in silence

contextId.occurrenceNote: These are actions of mourning. Alternate translation: "To show their mourning, they have thrown dust on their heads and put on sackcloth" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: They have thrown dust on their heads and put on sackcloth

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an action of mourning. Alternate translation: "have sorrowfully bowed their heads to the ground" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: have bowed their heads to the ground

contextId.occurrenceNote: These actions are used to mock and insult others. Alternate translation: "mock you by clapping their hands ... hiss and shake their heads" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: clap their hands ... hiss and shake their heads

contextId.occurrenceNote: This action shows a person's anger and that they are mocking others. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
This was an action often performed while praying. Alternate translation: "Lift up your hands to him in prayer" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: Lift up your hands to him
